ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] gordon answers
ygData.msgSnippet: What frustrates me - as far as I (and probably most bards) am concerned - the number one issue facing bards is Lullaby.  It has been addressed in what - three
ygData.messageBody:
What frustrates me - as far as I (and probably most bards) am concerned -
the number one issue facing bards is Lullaby. It has been addressed in
what - three or four months?

Slyde
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kenneth E. Bachman" <kbachman@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 03, 2000 2:22 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] gordon answers


> There's a thread on the Gameplay board titled "Bard Bugs/Not a Whine
(v2000.05.22) - long", which is a
> compilation (by Mrbard) of all of the Bard issues brought up on the board
to date (that he didn't consider
> silly). See:
> http://boards.station.sony.com/everquest/Forum4/HTML/044232.html
>
> The one that Gordon is referring to:
> * Brusco's Bombastic Bellow (55) - Intended to be an upgrade to dd bard
song to stun and damage target.
> Instead it HEALS the target and stuns. Also, it is resisted far more often
than the low level song.
>
> It now damages the target rather than healing it.
>
> They have also fixed the AC on singing steel.
>
> They have also requested player input on: level 49 song, whether dirge
should use mana or not, whether
> invis should be a component of the level 51 travel song.
>
> So they're moving ahead. Kinda slowly, but at least they're keeping in
touch a little more than they used
> to.
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 50 songs, Innoruuk
>
>
> "Reece, Tom CPT- 25IDL G4" wrote:
>
> > What was the one bard issue that got resolved?
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Sylly Songsynger [mailto:jgs@...]
> > Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 3:52 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] gordon answers
> >
> > Clipped:
> >
> > Bard Bugs/Not a Whine (v2000.05.22) - long
> > Abashi/Brad/Gordon, I have compiled a list of all bard bugs to date for
your
> > review and comments. Sorry this is so long, but there are a lot of bugs.
> >
> > (his answer)
> >
> > I apologize but it is taking a bit longer than I'd hoped to look into
these
> > issues. As some will notice, at least one issue has been resolved with
> > another being considered publicly.
> >
> > I'll get back with you soon.
> >
> > Just one note, has anyone tried the two psalms mentioned recently? Just
a
> > few weeks ago a bug was corrected that was causing secondary effects on
bard
> > songs to fail.
> >
> > -Gordon
>
>

with the subject submissions.
